    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Magic Sense](/Feats.aspx?ID=622) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Magus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=389" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
<trait label="Wizard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=166" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 48 <sup>1.1</sup>, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 211 <sup>4.0</sup>, [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 80 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Lich](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=179) (Level 14)

</column>

---

You have a literal sixth sense for ambient magic in your vicinity. You can sense the presence of magic auras as though you were always using a 1st-level [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) spell. This detects magic in your field of vision only. When you Seek, you gain the benefits of a 3rd-level [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) spell on things you see (in addition to the normal benefits of Seeking). You can turn this sense off and on with a free action at the start or the end of your turn.

**Special** This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast ([arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), or [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)).
